§ 153101. Organization The National Society of the Daughters of the American Revolution (in this chapter, the “corporation”) is a body corporate and politic in the District of Columbia. (Pub. L. 105–225, Aug. 12, 1998, 112 Stat. 1422.)
Historical and Revision Notes
RevisedSectionSource (U.S. Code)Source (Statutes at Large)
15310136:18 (words before “for patriotic”).Feb. 20, 1896, ch. 23, § 1 (words before “for patriotic”), 29 Stat. 8.
This section is substituted for the source provision for consistency in the revised title and to eliminate executed and unnecessary words.
